Reviews.Title: Another winner from Panasonic!
Reviews.Author: Dennis Hawley
Reviews.Content: I don't profess to be an expert on digital cameras; my many years of photography involved mostly 35mm film cameras (primarily SLRs and boat loads of accessories).  I purchased my first digital camera about 7 years ago (an Olympus Camedia C-4000Z, followed by a Lumix DMC-Z20, both of which still perform like new).  However, these cameras are somewhat bulky and don't lend themselves to carrying around to catch spur-of-the-moment shots.  Wanting something small and easily carried in a shirt or pant pocket, I began my research.I was somewhat disappointed to find that many small, ultra-compact digital cameras from some of the best known brands (Nikon, Canon, Olympus and others) really didn't have great reviews from users, at least those in the sub-$200 dollar range (which I was targeting).  Having been impressed with my first Lumix, and seeing many high marks bestowed upon a number of Lumix compacts and sub-compacts, I narrowed my search to that brand.When I noticed that Amazon was running a special price on this particular Lumix that had the features I was seeking, it was easy to make the choice.  Receiving the camera after only a few days from order, I immediately bought a 2gig SD memory card (although the camera itself will hold 40mg of images, which is not much), read the manual a couple of times and began shooting.  I was impressed by the quality feel of the camera, and liked the fact that the lens (that great Leica quality is a big plus) has a retracting cover.  As I expected, the quality of the photos (from fully automatic functioning) was top-notch.  I took various indoor shots in different lighting conditions, and then I took it outdoors and clicked off dozens of photos, all the while trying various adjustments available.  One can change the sensitivity (ISO) from 80 all the way to 1600 if desired.  Color selections include normal, natural, vivid, black & white, sepia, `cool' (a bluish tinge) and `warm' (a reddish tinge).One can set the picture size from 4000x3000 (suitable for up to 16" X 20" enlargements) down to 640x480 (for email attachments or web photos), as well as 4000 X 2248 for 16:9 display on a high-def television or computer monitor.  As with most other digital cameras, other settings can be adjusted as well (i.e. white balance, red eye removal, , etc.).Although it came with software (imaging and a PDF version of a more advanced manual than the paper one supplied), I was unable to load it in my PC (apparently my `service pack' needs to be upgraded).  Undaunted, I  simply took the card out, inserted into the computer's card reader and presto, pulled the pictures up, and saved to a file (the camera came with a USB cable to allow direct connection to a PC or hi-def monitor too).After fiddling with photo transfers a while, I then took numerous shots using the 5X optical zoom (most digital cameras in this price range only have a 3X optical zoom).  The zoom action was smooth and quick, and images showed no distortion.  I was able to photograph a pileated woodpecker from about 50 feet with the zoom maxed out, and the  resulting picture was worthy of framing.  Lumix's `Mega Stabilization' feature works great; I took a pic of a cat jumping and caught it in mid-air without a hint of blur.The camera also records video with sound; one can select from hi-def (720p) down to QVGA (four setting options available).  I recorded a few video segments in hi-def of a few minutes each (it will record up to 2 gigs of hi-def video).  Playing them back on the camera yielded fantastic quality; when I showed the videos to people, their jaws dropped over the image quality.  However, it is worth noting that while one can play back smooth video on the camera, playback on a PC or hi-def monitor will result in a jerking, fragmented playback (sort of like a video downloaded from a dial-up modem) UNLESS a `class 6' memory card is used (most SD cards are class 2, fine for photos but not for big-screen playback).  While I intend to get a class 6 memory card, I didn't buy this camera to use as a camcorder, so this is not a big issue for me.  It should also be noted that it is not possible to use the zoom feature when recording; while it would be nice if it did, I was aware of this prior to buying it, so obviously it was no show-stopper.A few more points; the rechargeable battery comes without a charge, and it takes about 100 minutes to fully charge (a charger is included).  I've had the camera two weeks now, have taken about 300 shots and 4 short HD videos, and the battery still has some charge left.  The time from one shot to ready for another is about 2 seconds.  The camera's small size (3.9" by 2.2" by .9") makes it easy to slip in a shirt or pant pocket.  I keep mine in my suit coat pocket during working time, but use a small padded case attached to my belt at other times.  I can whip it out and have it snapshot ready in less than 4 seconds now!I really can't identify anything negative about this camera, with the single exception of the inability to zoom while video recording.  Unless that is important to you, then there is no reason not to seriously consider this excellent little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little snapper!
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on a recent trip to Thailand. I have a Lumix FZ28 that I LOVE but it is somewhat cumbersome to carry around so I wanted a little "snapper" I could whip out easily on the spur of the moment when something funny happened in a bar or nightclub or I wanted a quick snapshot of something happening on the street or whatever. It was important to me that the camera be small and not a pain to carry around. I did NOT want to spend a lot of money since I already own a great camera so this little Panny seemed, at first glance, to fit the bill nicely.First off, for these perpetually whining types who only seem to write reviews to complain about what a camera DOESN'T do and how it pales in comparison to their SLR's etc, lets clarify what this camera actually IS first of all.The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 is a camera designed with simplicity in mind. There are NOT a lot of advanced functions. You have normal shooting mode, Panasonic's acclaimed, amazing Intelligent Auto mode, (makes it hard to take a bad photo- seriously!) a bunch of pre-set scene selections and video mode. In normal shooting mode, white balance, ISO and focus modes are pretty much all that can be adjusted. In Intelligent Auto mode, it's even less. This is a camera designed NOT for advanced photographers that demand maximum control over their photos, but for normal people that want to take great photos with a minimum of fuss- the kind of people that wouldn't know (or care) what aperture priority mode means and are not interested in spending days or weeks pouring over their cameras instructional manual to learn all the advanced features it has. The kind of people that want to unpack their new camera and start snapping straight away! On this level, keeping in mind it's target audience, the camera succeeds.What you DO get for your modest amount of money is a compact, well built little camera from a TOP manufacturer featuring a 12 megapixel sensor, a 28mm wide angle lens, 5 x optical zoom, Panasonic's tried and proven "Mega optical image stabilization", lightning fast auto-focus, focus assist lamp, the ability to shoot high definition video with sound and outstanding picture quality for a VERY reasonable price. A few years ago, a camera with these features would have cost a small fortune, now it can be had for peanuts and you will be thrilled with the quality of pictures it takes as long as you are not expecting something that will give your SLR a run for it's money!Anyone in the market for a cheap snapper, who does not demand a great deal of control over camera settings but still insists on excellent performance and image quality should give this little gem some serious consideration. Panasonic has created yet another winner! Five stars.

Reviews.Title: Affordable compact P&S; with bright wide angle lens.
Reviews.Author: Tekon
Reviews.Content: I've purchased this compact point and shoot based on the description of descent specifications & low price($100.) Although I like Canons, I've had 2 that malfunctioned in less than a year, so I decided to go with Panasonic this time. It has a bright wide angle lens, which I figured would handle low light well. And the 12megapixel hopefully would catch less noise unlike the 14mega pixel ones(the more pixel crammed in the same amount of space, the more prone the pixels are to heating up, hence creating noise... bunch little red/gray spots that shows up)I've had this camera for about a year. It has it's limitations, but it's still a fun one for the price.Pros:- Great deal for the price(unless you wanna spend 400 on a Canon S90)- Great lens, it's wide, and bright.- It's compact. fits in my pocket without too much bulge :)- Takes widely available and cheap SD cards that fit into most laptop's card readers... instead of obscure unpopular formats(expensive Fuji's xD, or Sony's memory sticks, which aren't used by other manufacturer, so when you switch brands, they become useless, there goes the investment...)- It's customizable depending on shooting needs/environments.- Good macro shots, provided you can stabilize the camera well enough(Either with small Gorilla pod, or by resting it on the ground/or something immobile.)- It records movies surprisingly well even in dimly lit places(provided you can keep your camera steady)- Good battery life.Cons:- The slide power switch, moves easily when I slide it into tight pouch(I got the MountainSmith's Cubik S, and that problem is solved. Before that I used to leave the camera on "playback" mode in case it turn on by accident, so that the lens doesn't accidentally protrude)- The setting on the camera sometimes needs to be adjusted quite a bit to get the right kind of exposure. In the film days, it was much easier... But this goes for any camera nowadays, even advanced DSLR needs to be set properly.- It's not that great in low light, it seems to come out grainy if I try to shoot without flash by bumping up the ISO. I think going beyond ISO 400~800 turns the image too grainy and then the details are lost. So if forces you to get close so that minimal details are lost. So aside from all the nit picky complaints, when it nails it, it does it well. I found that playing with EV+ & - exposure compensation can do a lot to set the moods. And the manually set white balance is quite accurate. It doesn't compare to a D-SLR, because that's not what it is. It's a point and shoot at a fraction of the cost. 5% of the cost to be precise! A bargain it is! If you take the time and get know you camera well, you'll get plenty of use out it. If you're more serious: You wanna enlarge photos 4ft wide or more to show in a gallery get a film camera with the best film and lens you can afford and take fewer shots. 2nd hand SLRs can be purchased for even $25~100, good lens are still expensive, but they really do make the difference.

Reviews.Title: Great value - excellent product
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L. Perez
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix has been reviewed by others as a good back-up or handy point and shoot for hobbyists.  To make sure I asked my friends who are more serious about photography and they confirmed this was a good brand and line.  The camera was really put to the test on my trip to Hawaii.  It passed with flying colors - I was able to get the best pictures I've ever been able to take.  I'm not that experienced with taking the time to make sure the shot is right but this camera and all its features makes me want to learn.  I used several scene modes and they turned out great!I would recommend this to anyone who wants the latest features most point and shoot cameras offer these days (image stabilization) but doesn't want to pay too much to get features they don't even know how to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Can't Beat The Price!!!
Reviews.Author: Timothy Snow "tsnow2"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera this past Friday with Free Super Saver Shipping, and it showed up Monday!  The camera is a great deal for the money.  Pictures are super clear and the functions are very user friendly.  I would definitely recommend this camera to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: pros & cons
Reviews.Author: W. Amaral
Reviews.Content: So, I do have professional experience with high end cameras, and have also reviewed and retailed point and shoot cameras.Personally, I've owned a couple point-and-shoots and the favorites have been, Nikon and Casio.  Though I've reviewed and liked a couple of older Panassonic's, I'm a bit disappointed at this one.... truly, I expected more from Panassonic.- great telephoto range:  nice wide angle and quick zoom to 5X.  In spite of a decently open lens, light just doesn't seem to make it's way in.  You don't have to go to too dark of an environment to notice lost of noise....- Okay if you won't crop you photos.... if you want to crop them afterwards... well, forget it.- Nice compatibility with SD cards (including the newest technologies - up to 64Gigs)- Standard/GOOD size camera body, considering a good larger lens.- Good battery/charger.. good lasting and quick charge.- Flash is well diffused... unlike a lot of pocket Canons.... I like that.  It doesn't reach very far though... but nice enough to take evening pics of friends at a restaurant/bar if you don't step more than three or four feet away... beyond that... noisy again.- Lens in pretty nice so I think the noisy problem is software related.... even in some very bright pictures, I'll notice way too much noise if I zoom in on a picture at all. (What's up with the software, Panasonic???  That should have been the easy part!!  The physics of making a good small camera should be the struggle.)-  Too many megapixels.... (this is a deceiving number ... the bigger number advertised does sell more!! quality actually goes down.... too many little cells crammed into small sensor size... so they catch less light)... maybe that's the problem with the noise.... 6,7,8 Megapixel cameras are not nearly as noise and you can still zoom in a good deal as well as enlarge.So, you don't crop, you're fine with this one.  (never use the digital zoom - but that goes for any camera... you can do that on the computer later and actually see how much you're losing).  It's simple, small, good zoom range, close up and some zoom ... you like that... this is a good camera.For less than a $100... a good option.  But if you want flexibility editing your pics later... cropping them, zooming on the computer, enlarging.... you might consider a Nikon or Casio... a little more expensive, but much better quality.....  those are not as good as the Panasonic on the zoom range, otherwise as good or better.

Reviews.Title: Good for convenience, not for picture quality
Reviews.Author: Jill B.
Reviews.Content: If you are mainly interested in this camera because of how small it is, then you'll like it. However, if you're at all concerned about picture quality, this is not for you. The images are very grainy and about half of mine would come out blurry. I returned it after a week. It would probably be ok if you just wanted to print 4 x 6 photos without any cropping (ie, not zooming in with your computer).

Reviews.Title: Great, small camera
Reviews.Author: Josh Hoevelmann
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife as an alternative to her digital SLR.  For under the $100 range this camera is great!  The flash does a great job as long as you're at least 4 feet or so from the subject.  It does take some getting used to the settings and which ones to use, but they work really well.  My biggest reason for choosing this over many others is that the digital stabilization is optical instead of digital.  This makes a big difference, especially when zooming a long way.  Be patient with this camera and play with the settings.  I mostly change two things.  Red eye off for candid, moving objects.  Red eye on when taking portraits.  Flash off when closer than 3 or 4 feet.  You can however, change the flash intensity if you are taking a lot of close ups.

Reviews.Title: System Error - Revised
Reviews.Author: MDB
Reviews.Content: Received product from Amazon quickly and looked forward to testing it out before an upcoming vacation. After charging the battery, reading the manual, formatting some SDHC cards, and playing around with the modes and menus, I tried it out. As the title says, I immediately received either "system error (zoom)" or "please turn camera off and on again" errors when I atempted to zoom (just out of the box so no drops or sand, etc.). The zoom functionality worked maybe three times out of dozens and dozens of attempts (and won't work period at this point). The lens does move (not stuck in any position) and the camera will take a picture. It just won't zoom, which makes it the equivalent of a disposable. I contacted Panasonic's customer service dept. after registering the product and they told me to reset the camera and retry, which I did to no avail (several times). Further, they advised sending it to their customer service center in Texas for potential replacement with a reconditioned model (if under warranty - which it better be since I got it a week ago - and the aforementioned reset didn't work). I guess a reconditioned is the best they'll do. Of course, I don't have a time frame of when the reconditioned model will arrive (will be mailing it to them shortly), so I may need to purchase another camera before I leave. Don't know if this is a known issue with this model, but needless to say I'm not too happy. I'll update the review if I get a camera that works.Revised review: Returned via Amazon's 30 day policy and received a new, working, model (much better than the refurbed option via Panasonic). Anyway, I used the camera pretty extensively and tried many of its functions. It isn't the greatest in low light (but you can improve things by playing around with the settings), and there are some issues with clarity/stabilization even with the OIS on. That said, it delivered some really good images and fits easily into any pocket (and well into a small Case Logic soft case also available on Amazon). Considering price, convenience, number of features, and solid image quality overall (and some images much better than that), I'd definitely recommend it (especially if you want something small to carry on your travels).

Reviews.Title: We love this little camera
Reviews.Author: B. Augustus
Reviews.Content: It powers up fast.Takes quick shots.The light settings are good.Picture quality is awesome!The HD Video is GREAT!The ONLY downside is that you can zoom while doing video, but thats common on point and shoot HD video.

Reviews.Title: Quality camera for its price range
Reviews.Author: Fortun Kimura
Reviews.Content: 1. Quality pictures for the price range- of course you always want better quality so buy the best you can afford2. Very straightforward to use3. I bought it because it was on sale, might have bought a similar canon if they were same price

Reviews.Title: A great balanced package
Reviews.Author: Lance Kozlowski "Lance"
Reviews.Content: This was offered below a hundred dollars for a while and it's a steal at that price. It was one of the few pocket cams that offered an F2.8 lens and a 28mm wide angle in that price range. I find the zoom button aggravating, starts slow and then goes too fast, but I will probably develop a better knack for it soon.  I bought this on a trip, and had no time to practice. I consider myself a serious amateur, and I was able to work most important settings within a few minutes. Excellent ease in that respect. I shoot in what is essentially "Program" mode, as this camera does not offer shutter or aperture modes (I find it too much trouble to go to "scenes" and iA mode is too auto for me). The exposure compensation adjustment is easy, quick and wonderful, tho the scale for it is oddly placed in the middle of the image (why not at the bottom?). Force flash mode, white balance and ISO all easy and quick to get to via a type of top menu with pull downs, like a computer program. Nice!  Color seems natural, exposure good, sharpness lacking a bit, but then, it is a cheap pocket camera! Quick startup, size and shape is wonderful. I would say it seems a bit slippery at the chromed edges, I have a feeling I will drop it someday. Some grippy points at the corners would really help. If you are a general shooter looking for a camera that makes life easy and is extremely portable, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Disapointing image quality sticking with Cannon SD1000 (7.2MP)
Reviews.Author: Core2Quad
Reviews.Content: I only used this camera for a few minutes.  Bought it from Amazon to replace my Cannon SD1000 (a very small 7.2MP camera).  I took a few shots with both computers and then loaded them on the computer.  Despite the Panasonic having more megapixels, the actual image quality when zoomed in to the same size on the computer screen, the 7.2MP Cannon from 3 years ago had a sharper image and better colors.  I also bought this camera because the HD mode, but it was not very impressive.  Even with a Class 6 memory card there were some stutters.  Needless to say, I returned this camera and will be keeping my Cannon SD1000, and perhaps purchase a larger camera in the future with a bigger lens for better image quality.  Manufacturers can pack 100MP's into a camera, but its not going to mean anything if the lens and CCD sensors can't handle it.  Don't buy into the MP game.  7-8MP's is plenty for a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: For the price, you can't beat it.
Reviews.Author: S. Holton
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price! The only thing that bothers me on it is the capture button, which seems to be a little too far to the left for my liking. Of course, I can live with that. We also have a larger and more expensive Panasonic Lumix, which we love. We were looking for something smaller and easier to carry for things like skiing and boating. This fits the bill perfectly. Sharp picture. Great zoom. Screen is great size for the small size of the camera. Even purchased one for MIL as a Christmas gift. Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: It Won't Last Very Long
Reviews.Author: Joe F.
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I purchase items and don't use them immediately.  I purchased this Panasonic Lumin DMC-FH1 12.1 MP Digital Camera in March of 2011 and didn't use for a year and a half.  I used it a total of 6 times, after first using it.  Recently, I was on vacation and it was working great in the short period of time I actually used it.  Then the automatic lens failed to close and an error message appeared on picture surface.  I went to a  National Camera Store, when I returned home, and was told it would have to be mailed into Panasonic and that they could not repair it, because this is what camera manufacturers do today. Panasonic does not allow camera stores to repair their cameras.  The desk person looked at it and said the lens was straight and the camera looked like it was brand new.  The cost to have Panasonic repair or replace this camera would be $82.00.  I paid $90.00 for the camera on Amazon.  Sooo this was not a good investment. I took less than a total of 50 pictures and then it failed. I will no longer purchase Panasonic cameras.  I have a Kokak EasyShare C813 camera I have had for about 8 years and it still works Great, but has less pixels power at 8.2.Very Very disappointed in this camera's durability!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Curious
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, it's easy but there is a real delay between pushing the shutter to take the picture and the actual shot. I also think that the pressure to activate the shutter is too much, so if you're not aware, you can get a blurred phto. I have taken some great shots with this camera, though and continue to use it. A good starter camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing point and shoot
Reviews.Author: mariajoselucena
Reviews.Content: Good picture quality, battery life, stability. For medium users works great. One year after i can recomend.Panasonic have another excelent product

Reviews.Title: This one is great!
Reviews.Author: R. Siqueira "RWS"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since December 2010, when I got it for $89.00. The price has increased recently on Amazon to $199.00. I wonder why? Now I know: It takes better pictures than more expensive cameras that cost double. I've personally compared the FH1 with the Canon SD1300IS (28mm/4x zoom) and the Panasonic DMC-ZR3 (25mm/8x zoom), and to my surprise the FH1 takes better pictures than both of them. The Canon pictures were a little soft and out of focus. I just bought the DMC-ZR3 and again the FH1 takes better photos overall. I got the ZR3 because of the extra zoom and 25mm for my next trip to Disneyland with my kids, but after comparing the same pictures taken with both the FH1 and ZR3, the FH1 got most of the pictures sharp and well exponsed, and might be the camera to take on my trip. The ZR3 did a little better outside in well lit conditions, but indoors the FH1 had better detail and the compression engine that was supposed to be worse than the ZR3, actually did better on low light than the ZR3. The 25mm with a small flash might be too much for the ZR3 to take good indoor pictures. The 28mm of the FH1 did better. Anyways, I've returned the Canon to Office Depot and I am still thinking if I will keep the ZR3 or not. But, the Panasonic DMC-FH1 has been a very good choice and that's why I am holding on to it.

Reviews.Title: Great customer service
Reviews.Author: Russell
Reviews.Content: I bought this item as a gift, I had to return the first one because it stopped working. I contacted Amazon and after a 5 minute conversation they sent out a new one. Awesome product and customer service.

Reviews.Title: just ok
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: biggest gripe with this camera is the LCD screen. The resolution is not that great. Pictures overall are decent and camera is easy to use and nice size but the screen is mediocre.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera - Digital 101
Reviews.Author: Dr. James E. Gilbert
Reviews.Content: A good camera for non-digital, senior citizen learners. Manual instructions and software instructions could be a bit more novice friendly. Takes great pictures despite attributes of novice photographers.

Reviews.Title: Never had one like this, and love it........
Reviews.Author: JPF
Reviews.Content: The price was great and am extremely pleased with this camera.........It has all I need in a camera of this type...Easy to work with great pictures.Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera
Reviews.Author: Waltersog
Reviews.Content: I have been user of panasonic's product for more than 4 years and this is a very good and reliable device. Extremely recommended.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: M. Burke "mattrx"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great photos in both regular and widescreen modes.  It is lite weight and the battery lasts a long time.  I took this camera recently out of the country on a week long trip.  I am not disappointed in the performance of the camera at all.

Reviews.Title: Good video introduction into a digital camera
Reviews.Author: Alex Plahotnuk
Reviews.Content: Everything is done to a high standard, including many features in a compact attractive design.Rechargable battery is a plus, especially when it does not require replacement for long.The only drawback is an inadequate video quality, considering its high pixel resolution (12 MP). The moving picture is a little shady, even though not too bad.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic
Reviews.Author: collectitalljmt
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for the price.  More zoom than most cameras in this price range.  All the bells and whistles you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: A. E. Tessler
Reviews.Content: I bought the DMC-FH1 as a Christmas gift for my wife to use for pics of the kids and around the house.  This camera certainly won't replace my dSLR (D40x/D70) but it does well with well-lit scenes.  Movie mode isn't anything to write home about without bright lighting and has given me some errors on playback with corrupted files.  I haven't had a chance to rule out my SD card from causing those, a faster card may complete the files faster and have better luck.I broke my own rule about only buying Canon p&s; cameras for their interface and speed, but for this use the more technical advantages of the s95 etc aren't needed.  Frankly when my cameras are handed off to family or friends they get set on AUTO anyway.  Canon did not have a comparable size camera with 720p (or higher) video at this price point when I bought mine.  Any p&s; is painful to use after using dSLRs with their lack of lag and higher performance.

Reviews.Title: Lumix - Little Wonder
Reviews.Author: Stephen A. Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: Excellent little camera with ajustable features or simple autofucus, point and shoot, capacity. Picture quality ad zoom features are excellent. I have both a Sony and Samsung cameras of similar size and choose to carry my Lumix with me on a daily basis because of its features and quality of the images it provides. couldn't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Takes GREAT pictures!
Reviews.Author: MrsRuffin
Reviews.Content: I loved this purchase. I bought it because my husband and I were going to Vegas and wanted something small and lightweight that we could get clear photos under any circumstances. My husband is a notoriously poor photographer and even he pulled out a couple great ones. I will emphasize that while it is very lightweight it is reasonably sturdy. ( But you really want to keep it in a case for good measure.) All in all, I felt like we got a great deal for the price and I am sooo happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1
Reviews.Author: Archil
Reviews.Content: Lumix is my first time purchased camera. I was searching for the best choice price/quality and I think it's one of the best. I take photos of my friends, mine and other cars which I like most of all or take pictures when I go out for holidays. It's really very nice cam, I enjoy it so much.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: S. Siegel
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife so she doesn't have to use my DSLR. This is a great little lightweight camera that has a lot of flexibility in exposure settings. It takes pictures VERY quickly (one of my major complaints about most point-and-shoots is the time it takes to take a pic), and is a lot of fun to use. The pictures come out great--crystal clear with great color--better color than some of the more expensive options. The menus and controls aren't as intuitive as I'd like, and I don't like the switching between review and camera modes, but it's not a hinderance to using the camera. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Very Happy With
Reviews.Author: monkeldad
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research and bought this right B4 Christmas for $89. the newer version (FH20) is $30 more for 14meg. there is so much advertising for the Nikon,Kodak,Sony,Canon I was hesitant to try a Panasonic, but none of those cameras were rated that good by the consumer except this one so i kept coming back to it.I seem to buy new cameras every year because I haven't found that perfect camera. last year it was the Sanyo Exacti odd shaped movie/camera. slow between pics and its odd shape made me not like it fairly fast, no auto lens cover was a pain plus i couldn't get anyone to take pics with it because it was different from a regular camera.Perfect to me is... big screen,takes fast pics,turns on fast,pocket size, lots of zoom, bright flash, auto cover over lens plus cost around $100.I would rate this one very close to a "5" thus far, I have used it for a couple of weeks now and other than it is slippery to hold i really like it. battery life seems to be very good since i haven't even charged it yet.* Speed of taking pics is awesome, plus I did buy the Class 6 SD card too.* turns on fast and closes fast.* LCD screen is not as high resolution as I thought but its good enough.* i have compared the Intelligent mode and std mode and the "IM" pics are a little better so I suck with that. once you select intelligent mode it stays in that mode even after you turn it off which i like!* Buttons are a little small but over all I really like this camera.* Flash is bright!* Zoom is fast, can't use during movie though.* takes very good movies even in low light, did a Bday cake with candles and it looked great.* the key to taking pics is holding the button down half way to focus and then press it down.* Cute "scene" pics is great, it automatically puts happy birthday on the pic for you. 3 to chose from.* You have to take the battery out to charge it unless you buy the adapter, it does come out and the charger is small plus you don't have to a USB port to charge it so I'm good with that.Enjoy,

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Ceron
Reviews.Content: I took photos to my wife and the resolution was perfect! the zoom es very good!I think the camera is perfect for taking exposures of everything. I love it!

Reviews.Title: The price - product is excellent
Reviews.Author: FreddyCruze.ni
Reviews.Content: good price, good product, good quality and as always good service delivery. The video camera is excellent. The images are also excellent. The price - product is excellent. If you can not buy cameras from U $ 500 this is a good option. Very comfortable and practical thanks to its size.Ideal for the lover of photography without being a professional. You can take on outings with friends and capture good times in a high quality and comfortable way

Reviews.Title: This is a great purchase.
Reviews.Author: Kraig Bailey "kbails84"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera that you can take out with your friends and get a many of great images! This is the one for you. It is small, great "Bang for the Buck" and provides great battery life along with 12.1 MP image quality.Great product, thank you for your time.

Reviews.Title: Makes you feel sorry paying so little for something so good
Reviews.Author: Raúl Horacio García
Reviews.Content: This camera shows the lengths Panasonic has come in developing digital cameras. What you pay in this case, $89 is too few for such a product. What shocked me at first was the minute size of it. This camera is a keeper. Before purchasing one I was pondering whether or not I'd be able to understand all the myriad buttons & functions cameras come with these days and surprisingly, I fared better than I even expected. I picked it up so soon and found the type of picture format i liked with little strain and frustration. However, the zoom was elusive to me. (I didn't think I needed to read an instruction manual given the common occurence of a digital camera these days but maybe I should've) I had to find somebody show me that the zoom relied in the form of a sort-of-wheel one could steer to the left/right in order to magnify/retract the image. This was located right at the front of the shoot button.If anything, this only made the camera so much better. There are so many functions, I personally dislike the intelligent auto format which is supposed to select the best picture type for any environment. But that's just another option which maybe somebody else less detail-oriented may find appealling. I rather take pictures which display a wide array of colors and an intense fullness to them and this camera pulls that off extremely well! It's only a matter of finding what picture size/quality/zoom /proper alignment of shades, brightness, contrast/ intensity of colors / flash or no flash to take pictures of a quality you could not believe for $89!Also, the lithium-ion battery lasts for an eternity. According to the manafacturer it can last up to 300+ shots. Truth is, you won't be found wanting with this camera.

Reviews.Title: A little disappointed
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was slightly disappointed. Pictures just don't come out as nicely as promised. Lots of movement and in dark situations the camera doesn't perform great. I wanted an all-in-one camera that would automatically set to optimal settings, but even when using the Intellingent Auto feature, it doesn't seem to work out well.

Reviews.Title: great camera for everyday use
Reviews.Author: Lynda M. Conner
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 10 year old son and have been extremely happy with it. It is easy to use and takes clear pictures. Pretty good in low light even.  I love that we can plug in the battery to re=charge. No using a bunch of AA batteries. Overall, I highly recommend this camera. (My daughter has a Panasonic also and we have never had any problems with it. I always try to buy the Panasonic brand.)

Reviews.Title: Very good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: northmedic33
Reviews.Content: Over all, I am very pleased with this camera. It takes good pics, and is very simple to use. I would suggest this camera for anyone who is looking for a good point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Photos
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah Edwards
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a present for my wife.  I tested it and compared it to other digital cameras.  Then, I returned this camera, and bought my wife the Canon SD1300 IS instead because it is clearly a superior camera that costs only a little more.I compared the Panasonic Lumix DMC FP1, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1, the Canon Powershot S500 (my 8 year old malfunctioning digital camera), the Canon Powershot SD1300 IS, and my Canon Rebel T1i (my dSLR...an unfair comparison, but I wanted benchmark for these cheaper cameras).  I had always liked my old Canon S500, but I read some reviews on Amazon and other websites, and it seemed like the Panasonic cameras were really good cameras at a great price.For me, the number one consideration is picture quality.  If you don't have that, you don't have anything.  Things that detract from picture quality are poor signal to noise, lack of sharpness, poor color rendering, and various artifacts.  Therefore, I tested these 5 cameras under different conditions.  I copied the jpegs onto my computer, and I looked at the images at 100% to see how good they really are.  The most revealing results were shot under medium light indoors.  This is very important if you ever want to take any indoor pictures.  The results were as follows (from best to worst):1) Canon T1i (1 year old, about $700), excellent pictures even without flash2) Canon SD1300 IS (brand new, about $110), very good photos for a compact digital camera3) Canon S500 (8 years old, $400 new, not performing as well as it used to)Surprisingly, although this is not shooting as well as it used to 8 years ago, it still outperformed the Panasonic cameras.4) Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 (brand new, about $90), this had very poor signal to noise and moderately poor color rendering.5) Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP1 (brand new, about $80), this camera performed significantly worse even than the FH1.  The non extending lens is nifty but yields poor photos.In addition to this, I found that the Canon was easier to operate and easier to take videos.Nowadays, compact digital cameras are quite inexpensive.  Do yourself a favor and buy a high quality camera.  More megapixels does NOT necessarily mean better pictures, and having a large optical zoom can sometimes compromise lens quality and thus picture quality.  Also, consider sensor size: this can make a big difference in picture quality, though some manufacturers make better sensors even when comparing sensors of the same size.  In my experience Canon consistently makes high quality digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Excelente camara a bajo costo
Reviews.Author: WILFREDO DIAZ SANCHEZ "wilfdiaz"
Reviews.Content: Es una excelente camara a pesar del poco tiempo que la tengo. Ninguna contrariedad al respecto. He tomada una cantidad considerable de fotos y han sido nítidas, execelente color. Todavia hay opciones que no he utilizado aún. Por todo lo demás la recomiendo y al precio que la vendió AMAZON es una ganga.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Toh
Reviews.Content: I had great Lumix used for more than 5 years. So, I decided to be Lumix's customer again.However, this camera is as not good as I expected.The quality of pictures is really bad (not clear and a lot of noise)The body,buttons are made of a kind of cheap material (this is the main reason I returned it)I still like Panasonic and going to buy another one but higher grade.If you expect too much quality from this price, should not go with it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Walter Cordova "GuaLcoR"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to a friend because I lost her camera. It works great, good pictures. If you want still better pictures, make sure you buy a Lumix with leica lens.

Reviews.Title: lumix DMC-FH1
Reviews.Author: jack tar
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use compact point and shoot camera with some option capabilities this is a good camera to start with as a first camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Gordon S. Ferris
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and memory card on Wed. 12.22 and received it on Friday 12.24. I used the free shipping. I'm wowed with the great service. I haven't used the camera yet but just opening the package I can see the quality. I'll be back with a review on how the camera operates.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel effective recording
5X optical zoom
2-11/16" LCD screen
Optical image stabilization
Wide-angle lens for shooting landscapes and large groups
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
